s.text: For example, out of a sampling of 481 Hindi loanwords (that is, I know, an odd number for a sampling of any kind, but it happens to be the number I had carded as of the moment I began writing this article), 167 were borrowed by Hindi from Sanskrit and another four from Pakrit.

, the Random House 2nd Unabridged ). We know that the language is inconsistent, and there can be nothing wrong in reporting that fact: the dictionary merely reflects the practice of the majority of written citations available to its compilers.
